Do you still support our 2nd Amendment after the Vegas Shooting?
Domestic violence or cancer awareness, or PD goings on...staff continues to do a great job keeping the community informed.

A lot of people are talking about the #LVMPD timeline 6 minute issue .I believe the real issue with the timeline is related to MGM. The Casinos do not like to call the police department for assistance, ever! They usually handle everything internally and I would not doubt that the first calls to 911 wasn't made from the hotel. It was probably reported over the radio by police officers below and attendees of the concert far before MGM called 911 (if they ever did). So the security guard was shot, he radios Casino security, they send more security up, don't call police, guy starts breaking out windows and starts shooting the crowd, and reports to police department start occurring 6 minutes later. The exterior hotel glass isn't easy to break out. even with bullets. So it could have easily taken 6 minutes before he began shooting into the crown. Easy to explain the 6 minutes. Although make no mistake, MGM is covering their asses first and foremost!
Great job and response by LVMPD #VegasStrong #MGMPRmachine #Route91 #MGM #protectingfromliability #Ellen #MGMSecurity #firstresponders #heroesinthecrowd #LVMPDStrong

Joanne is a very detail oriented team player that is highly organized and works excellent in a team environment. Joanne is an excellent communicator and engages team members to bring out their strengths while encouraging both and volunteers to identify their passions and most importantly follow their passions.  Joanne is a go getter and knows how to make things happen from nothing with little or no supervision.  Joanne goes "all in" with all the projects she undertakes and would be a welcomed addition to any team.

summary: John McLaughlin's greatest purpose and passion is to provide safe environments where people, companies and organizations can thrive, based on their passion, skills, relationships and commitment. He has extensive government and private industry leadership experience. Mr. McLaughlin has a Masters in Business Administration from Pepperdine University and completed graduate studies in Social Work at the University of Southern California. He has received extensive training in leadership and management. Mr. McLaughlin provides the firm's vision, leadership, organizational culture, and relationship building for the real estate, watersports and cable watersports parks and development of lakes and luxury homes. The firm is owner and/or operators for cable watersports complexes. Mr. McLaughlin is a member of Young President's Organization (YPO).
name: John McLaughlin
title: CEO /President at Westside Water Sports, Inc.
